Posts.Content: pepper_cook wrote: I think the ps sewed the muscle down to the rib cartilege with my exchange 4 weeks ago. It sure hurts to wear a bra. Would I cause damage by going braless day and night. I will put up with the pain if I will get better results by wearing the bra. Do you recommend bra at night also. My ps says do what is most comfortable. Thanks in advance. 7/20/10 Bilateral Mastectomies, Nipple Sparing, Right Sentinal Node biopsy, Tissue expanders, 0/1 lymph node Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ok to go braless at 4 weeks post exchange? pepper_cook stlcardsfan

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2011 02:20PM pepper_cook wrote: Thanks for the input! At what point did he clear you?
Posts.Title: Ok to go braless at 4 weeks post exchange? pepper_cook stlcardsfan

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 05:27PM pepper_cook wrote: it will not affect your surgery at all. You will need to tell surgery staff if you have a tampon in because you do not whant to leave it in to long. It would be best if you could wear a pad and panties but I had a catheter for my mastectomy and exchange = no panties. The surgery staff will help you. Do not worry .... they deal with this all the time. it is no biggie. nothing to stress over.
Posts.Title: Very TMI question BioAdoptMom3 BioAdoptMom3

Posts.Content: pepper_cook wrote: I am training for a marathon one year post bilateral mastectomy and seven months post exchange. Am I going to cause damage if I do this? I wear a highly supportive bra. The marathon is in October and we are up to 13 miles in our training program. 7/20/10 Bilateral Mastectomies, Nipple Sparing, Right Sentinal Node biopsy, Tissue expanders, 0/1 lymph node Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: training for marathon 7 months post exchange pepper_cook drdolittle

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 03:06AM pepper_cook wrote: I had suspicious MRI and asked my BS if I could skip biopsy and do BMX, SNB, TE's  she wrote a letter to my insurance company and they approved it based on the fact that mammography is not a good diagnostic tool for me due to dense breast tissue and also based on the fact that my family history is similar to yours. I would have faced MRI's every six months with grave worry.
Posts.Title: Insurance Approval for BXM michelekb Kim09

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2010 07:45PM pepper_cook wrote: I am 43. My mammo was clear but I had MRI due to dense breast tissue and strong family history. My mother was 39 at diagnosis, he sister was 50 and my maternal grandmother was 60. MRI "lit up"  I choose not to have biopsy. I am scheduled for bilat mx with recon. - tissue expanders then silicone implants. I will have sentinal node biopsy at time of mastectomies. My surgery is scheduled for July 20.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 09:34AM pepper_cook wrote: My BMX, SNB and TE's was  July 20. My lymph nodes were negative! I will get full pathology report on Wednesday when I see PS. I have two drains. Side in which they did not do SNB is down to 28 cc in 24 hours for 2 days in a row. The other is at 40cc. I am really feeling good. Range of motion is returning. I might try today without pain meds. We shall see.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 06:07AM pepper_cook wrote: Today is my 3 week post op appointment. I hope he will fill the TE's today.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2010 04:38PM pepper_cook wrote: eileen 1955      Thank you for remembering me in prayer on my surg date.  I think the fact that the dense breast tissue does not make mammograms very effective and my very strong maternal family history allowed BS to do this without biopsy. I just came right out and asked if this was an option and she said certainly. It took a month for insurance to approve the procedure. The waiting is so hard. I do feel fortunate so far but we will see what the future holds after diagnosis. I know the surgery will be done but will I face chemo or radiation?  I hope not.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx
